body_html:
Closing this out, since it's not a TensorFlow bug or feature request.

That said, your code that converts from 3D data to a TensorProto looks wrong. In particular notice this snippet:

   for(int i = 0; i < data.length; i++) {
        for(int j = 0; j < data[0].length; j++) {
            for(int k = 0; k < data[0][0].length; k++) {
                builder.addFloatVal(data[k][j][i]);
            }
        }
    }

I think you meant to say this:

   for(int i = 0; i < data.length; i++) {
        for(int j = 0; j < data[0].length; j++) {
            for(int k = 0; k < data[0][0].length; k++) {
                builder.addFloatVal(data[i][j][k]);
            }
        }
    }

Also note that the TensorShapeProto documentation describes how the order of dims affects the data layout. Namely that data is in row-major order:

tensorflow/tensorflow/core/framework/tensor_shape.proto

Line 31 in c4c19f1

// The order of entries in "dim" matters: It indicates the layout of the
